comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: Chiromo (top centre) is on the Shire River in southern Malawi (Nyasaland). My guess is that the photographer was on his, or her, way up to Nyasaland - possibly it's the same person who took those photos in Zomba.

comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: Delagoa Bay became Lourenco Marques and then, I think, Maputo. It's in southern Mocambique.

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: At Chinde, on the northernmost mouth of the Zambezi, in the 1890s was a British Concession (see photo 105-8) and a Post Office of Exchange where mail and other material was sorted for B.C.A. districts, German territory and the Congo Free State before being shipped upriver to Chiromo and beyond.
